meanings.definition: A crisp, crunchy sound or sensation
meanings.sent1: The campfire crackling in the night was comforting.
meanings.sent2: I love the crackling of leaves under my feet in autumn.
meanings.sent3: The crackling of the cereal as I poured milk over it made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The crackling of the fire seemed to speak to me in its own language.
meanings.sent5: The crackling of the popcorn in the microwave filled the room with a delightful aroma.

meanings.definition: The crisp, browned skin of roasted pork
meanings.sent1: The chef's specialty was the perfectly crispy crackling on the pork roast.
meanings.sent2: The crackling on the pork was so deliciously crunchy.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't resist sneaking a piece of crackling from the roast before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The crackling on the pork crackled like a symphony in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The crackling on the pork roast was the highlight of the meal, adding a delightful texture.

meanings.definition: A series of short, sharp snapping noises
meanings.sent1: The crackling of the twigs under our feet echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The crackling of the firewood signaled the start of our camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The crackling of the bubble wrap popping was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The crackling of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent5: The crackling of the bonfire added a sense of warmth and coziness to the chilly evening.
